cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) west of Cabo Cruz, Cuba and 100 mi (160 km) south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across Cuba, then turning north-northwest over the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s west coast before curving northeast through the southeastern U.S. and accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward New Jersey and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely near the Nature Coast / Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for parts of central Cuba; Tropical Storm Watch for lower Florida Keys, Florida Bay, parts of Florida west coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for much of Cuba and the lower Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Florida Keys and west coast, northern Gulf Coast, and the U.S. Atlantic coastline from Florida to New England (including New Jersey)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible if the storm tracks just offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft and coastal inundation possible along New Jersey shore during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 1–3 in (locally 4 in) on 9 July with brief urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; brief spin-up tornadoes can’t be ruled out as the storm exits
